titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: When I came to my study about 8 a.m. I was impressed by the sound of guns, which I immediately surmised to be from the sea. Later in the day, my surmise was confirmed.
A German squadron had bombarded the Hartlepools, Whitby, & Scarborough, inflicting considerable loss of life on the civilian population, and doing much damage to property

At first we were encouraged to believe that the enemy had been attacked & sunk, but later information dispelled our hopes, & we learned with surprise & humiliation that the German ships succeeded in returning to their own ports unscathed! This will put heart into the German people, & give a plausible text for much official lying. I signalized the occasion by buying from Rushworth several pieces of furniture!!
